intro: Cymbopetalum longissimum, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pinkish-red bracts that resemble delicate fans. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked in favor of its showy foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Cymbopetalum longissimum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
